item.title: lou add a quote by Andre Breton
item.description: "A game: say something. Close your eyes and say something. Anything, a number, a name. Like this (she closes her eyes): Two, two what? Two women. What do they look like? Wearing black. Where are they? In a park. . . . And then, what are they doing? Try it, it's so easy, why don't you want to play? You know, that's how I talk to myself when I'm alone, I tell myself all kinds of stories. And not only silly stories: actually, I live this way altogether." -- Andre Breton

item.title: lou add a quote by Andre Breton
item.description: "Beauty is like a train that ceaselessly roars out of the Gare de Lyon and which I know will never leave, which has not left. It consists of jolts and shocks, many of which do not have much importance, but which we know are destined to produce one <i>Shock</i>, which does...The human heart, beautiful as a seismograph...Beauty will be CONVULSIVE or will not be at all." -- Andre Breton

item.title: lou add a quote by Andre Breton
item.description: "Words make love with one another." -- Andre Breton

item.title: lou add a quote by Andre Breton
item.description: "The important thing is that man is lost in time, in the moment that immediately precedes him - which only attests, by reflection, to the fact that he is lost in the moment that follows" -- Andre Breton

item.title: lou add a quote by Andre Breton
item.description: "Beauty will be convulsive or will not be at all." -- Andre Breton

item.title: lou add a quote by Andre Breton, french surrealist visiting Mexico
item.description: "Our art movement is not needed in this country." -- Andre Breton, french surrealist visiting Mexico

item.title: lou add a quote by Andre Breton
item.description: "May night continue to fall upon the orchestra" -- Andre Breton

item.title: lou add a quote by André Breton
item.description: "Humor (is) the process that allows one to brush reality aside when it gets too distressing." -- André Breton

item.title: lou add a quote by André Breton
item.description: "Life’s greatest gift is the freedom it leaves you to step out of it whenever you choose." -- André Breton

item.title: lou add a quote by Andre Breton
item.description: "Tell me whom you haunt and I’ll tell you who you are." -- Andre Breton

item.title: lou add a quote by andre breton
item.description: "The purest surrealist act is walking into a crowd with a loaded gun and firing into it randomly" -- andre breton

item.title: lou add a quote by Andre Breton
item.description: "The clouds were disappearing rapidly, leaving the stars to die. The night dried up." -- Andre Breton

item.title: lou add a quote by André Breton
item.description: "My wish is that you may be loved to the point of madness." -- André Breton

item.title: lou add a quote by André Breton
item.description: "The imaginary is what tends to become real." -- André Breton

item.title: lou add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "There is a crack in everything. That's how the light gets in." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: lou add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "The last refuge of the insomniac is a sense of superiority to the sleeping world." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: lou add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: lou add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Here's to the few who forgive what you do, and the fewer who don't even care" -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: lou add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "Never make a decision when you need to pee." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: lou add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "I have tried in my way to be free." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: lou add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "ordinary eternal machinery, like the grinding of the stars" -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: lou add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "The aim of life is to live, and to live means to be aware, joyously, drunkenly, serenely, divinely aware." -- Henry Miller

item.title: lou add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Everything we shut our eyes to, everything we run away from, everything we deny, denigrate, or despise, serves to defeat us in the end." -- Henry Miller

item.title: lou add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Everybody says sex is obscene. The only true obscenity is war." -- Henry Miller

item.title: lou add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "If there is to be any peace it will come through being, not having." -- Henry Miller

item.title: lou add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "There is no salvation in becoming adapted to a world which is crazy" -- Henry Miller

item.title: lou add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "I have no money, no resources, no hopes. I am the happiest man alive." -- Henry Miller

item.title: lou add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: lou add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "A day without laughter is a day wasted." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: lou add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank
